medium: Marker, ballpoint pen, and paint on posterboard
text: Prophet Royal Robertson’s cramped handwriting and distinctive drawings fill the page with vitriolic messages questioning the morality and sanity of his world and his ex-wife, Adell Brent. A nearly obscured calendar grid for “June 1989 AD” occupies the center of the page while dates, prayers, and Christian Bible verses fill the border. Adell disappeared from Robertson’s life sometime in the 1970s. After she left, Robertson began recording the visions he had received since childhood on poster board with markers and ballpoint pens. The scenes swing from apocalyptic to utopian, but Adell’s name continually reappears to signify Robertson’s disillusionment with the world in which he lived.
title: Untitled
